description:
A series of short animations that show different worlds and different characters. These episodes are designed to take the viewer into a psychological world of fantasy and mystery.

The shorts are as follows:

1) Keikaku (圭角)
2) Chicken hoken ni kanyuu kudasai (チキン保険に加入ください)
3) Toujin Kit (陶人キット 予告編)
4) Tsukiyo no Ban ni (月夜の晩に)
5) Table & Fishman
6) Kuuchuu Izakaya (空中居酒屋)

Note: Episode 3 "Toujin Kit" is a teaser trailer for a short film released as part of the Genius Party Beyond anthology.

tags.name: Anthology
tags.description: A collection of separate works collated into a single release.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

title.native: ジーニアスパーティービヨンド

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/39493039/) | [Website](https://mkikai.jimdofree.com/)

After dropping out of high school, he joined [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/) at the age of 18 because [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/), whom he was a fan of, was a part of the studio. He soon stopped showing up at Telecom because of all the in-betweening work he was given, and was thus fired. He then joined the production of [Royal Space Force](https://anilist.co/anime/1034/), but quit after a week. He then gave up on being an animator and started working part-time jobs while trying to get a manga serialization. At this time, he was living with [Kazuyoshi Yaginuma](https://anilist.co/staff/133410/), who convinced him to take part in [Akira](https://anilist.co/anime/47/) as a key animator.

He was heavily influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) during [Gosenzo-sama Banbanzai](https://anilist.co/anime/4639/)'s production.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kojimorimoto) | [Website](http://www.kojimorimoto.com)

Fan of anime such as [Lupin the 3rd](https://anilist.co/anime/1412/Lupin-the-3rd/) and [Future Boy Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/302/Future-Boy-Conan/), after graduating from the Osaka Designers' college, he joined [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) and soon after Studio [Annapuru](https://anilist.co/studio/583/Annapuru). He wanted to work with esteemed Director [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/Osamu-Dezaki) since [Gamba's Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/5267/Gambas-Adventure/) was particularly striking to him.

Interested in effects animation, he cites [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/Yoshinori-Kanada) and [Kazuhide Tomonaga](https://anilist.co/staff/110219/Kazuhide-Tomonaga) as major influences. He had his first breakthrough as animator on [Space Adventure Cobra](https://anilist.co/anime/2451/Space-Adventure-Cobra/) and [Golgo 13: The Professional](https://anilist.co/anime/1760/), in which his effects work and fun character animation was highly praised. Later his work became increasingly more experimental, combining his animation with intricate art design and CGI.

During his period at Annapuru he befriended [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/Takashi-Nakamura) and the two worked on several projects together even after leaving the studio. [Katsuhiro Ootomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872/Katsuhiro-Ootomo) recognized his talent and Morimoto became a key figure in many of his works. He debuted as Director on [Robot Carnival](https://anilist.co/anime/2182/Robot-Carnival/).

In 1985 he founded [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/) alongside former Ghibli producer [Eiko Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103607/Tanaka-Eiko). He would later leave the studio in 2011.

Married to [Atsuko Fukushima](https://anilist.co/staff/118789/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/osamukoba) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小林治_(イラストレーター%29) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osamu_Kobayashi_(illustrator%29)

Osamu Kobayashi was a Japanese director, animator, illustrator and designer, noted for having directed shows such as [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/), [Paradise Kiss](https://anilist.co/anime/322/) and [Someday's Dreamers II](https://anilist.co/anime/4483/). After graduating from high school, he worked as a mangaka and designer, but following his participation in the video game Grandia as a designer, he was mainly active in the field of animation.

Kobayashi passed away due to kidney cancer on April 17, 2021.

Brother of [Makoto Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/117729/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the 1945 born director, [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105374/)._

The president of Studio 4°C, an animation studio she founded with Koji Morimoto and Yoshiharu Sato in 1986. Tanaka is also the chief executive officer of a production company called Beyond C, which initiated the project with Michael Arias that became Tekkon Kinkreet. 

Tanaka was an executive producer on Tekkon Kinkreet and Mind Game, both Studio 4°C films. She was also an animation producer on Beyond and The Second Renaissance Part 1 for the Animatrix project. Tanaka previously worked with Studio Ghibli and played the role of line producer on My Neighbor Totoro and Kiki's Delivery Service.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ando_beanjam)

Pioneered the cel shaded, expressive look that distinguishes [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/)'s CG work.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hidekazuohara)

After graduating from the Department of Industrial Chemistry at Miyakonojo Technical College he joined [Topcraft](https://anilist.co/studio/363/) (later [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)), where he partook in the production of [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/). Afterwards he turned to CM production and joined Studio Arrow and later became freelance. Today he collaborates often with [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), working on many of their projects as animator, character designer and director.

(Source: AniDB)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kojimorimoto) | [Website](http://www.kojimorimoto.com)

Fan of anime such as [Lupin the 3rd](https://anilist.co/anime/1412/Lupin-the-3rd/) and [Future Boy Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/302/Future-Boy-Conan/), after graduating from the Osaka Designers' college, he joined [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) and soon after Studio [Annapuru](https://anilist.co/studio/583/Annapuru). He wanted to work with esteemed Director [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/Osamu-Dezaki) since [Gamba's Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/5267/Gambas-Adventure/) was particularly striking to him.

During his period at Annapuru he befriended [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/Takashi-Nakamura) and the two worked on several projects together even after leaving the studio. [Katsuhiro Ootomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872/Katsuhiro-Ootomo) recognized his talent and Morimoto became a key figure in many of his works. He debuted as Director on [Robot Carnival](https://anilist.co/anime/2182/Robot-Carnival/).

In 1985 he founded [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/) alongside former Ghibli producer [Eiko Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103607/Tanaka-Eiko). He would later leave the studio in 2011.

Married to [Atsuko Fukushima](https://anilist.co/staff/118789/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hidekazuohara)

After graduating from the Department of Industrial Chemistry at Miyakonojo Technical College he joined [Topcraft](https://anilist.co/studio/363/) (later [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)), where he partook in the production of [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/). Afterwards he turned to CM production and joined Studio Arrow and later became freelance. Today he collaborates often with [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), working on many of their projects as animator, character designer and director.

(Source: AniDB)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kojimorimoto) | [Website](http://www.kojimorimoto.com)

Fan of anime such as [Lupin the 3rd](https://anilist.co/anime/1412/Lupin-the-3rd/) and [Future Boy Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/302/Future-Boy-Conan/), after graduating from the Osaka Designers' college, he joined [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) and soon after Studio [Annapuru](https://anilist.co/studio/583/Annapuru). He wanted to work with esteemed Director [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/Osamu-Dezaki) since [Gamba's Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/5267/Gambas-Adventure/) was particularly striking to him.

Interested in effects animation, he cites [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/Yoshinori-Kanada) and [Kazuhide Tomonaga](https://anilist.co/staff/110219/Kazuhide-Tomonaga) as major influences. He had his first breakthrough as animator on [Space Adventure Cobra](https://anilist.co/anime/2451/Space-Adventure-Cobra/) and [Golgo 13: The Professional](https://anilist.co/anime/1760/), in which his effects work and fun character animation was highly praised. Later his work became increasingly more experimental, combining his animation with intricate art design and CGI.

During his period at Annapuru he befriended [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/Takashi-Nakamura) and the two worked on several projects together even after leaving the studio. [Katsuhiro Ootomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872/Katsuhiro-Ootomo) recognized his talent and Morimoto became a key figure in many of his works. He debuted as Director on [Robot Carnival](https://anilist.co/anime/2182/Robot-Carnival/).

In 1985 he founded [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/) alongside former Ghibli producer [Eiko Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103607/Tanaka-Eiko). He would later leave the studio in 2011.

Married to [Atsuko Fukushima](https://anilist.co/staff/118789/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hidekazuohara)

After graduating from the Department of Industrial Chemistry at Miyakonojo Technical College he joined [Topcraft](https://anilist.co/studio/363/) (later [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)), where he partook in the production of [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/). Afterwards he turned to CM production and joined Studio Arrow and later became freelance. Today he collaborates often with [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), working on many of their projects as animator, character designer and director.

(Source: AniDB)
Makoto Usugane is a production assistant.

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/). Older brother of [You Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/).

He is known for having reached great expertise in many techniques from realistic animation to digital compositing. This gives him the ability to have full control over his works, often being responsible for the key frames, in-betweens, finishing, photography and backgrounds of the scenes he is in charge of.

His skilled use of coloring and compositing, together with the realistic depiction of movement make his works to be often mistaken for computer generated animation.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Ghost in the Shell (Video Game, 1997) (OP Key Animation)
- Tales of Phantasia (Video Game, 1998) (Cutscene Director, Animation Director, Key Animation)
- Valkyrie Profile Series (Video Game, 1999-2008) (Character Design, Art Design) 
- Kafu ~Kono Shirabe ga Kimi ni Todokimasu You ni~ (Visual Novel, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography, CG Animation)
- Sakura Wars 3: Paris is Burning? (Video Game, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-Between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Akiiro Renka (Visual Novel, 2005) (OP Director, Animation Character Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Muv-Luv Alternative (Visual Novel, 2006) (Cutscene Mecha Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography) !~
